name: Finale Font Annotation
summary: Learn about .FAN files and view a list of programs that open them.

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download

content: MakeMusic Finale is a professional music composition program used by composers. As part of creating musical scores, composers can add text that uses different fonts. Each Finale font is accompanied by a FAN file, which contains annotations that define the height and width of each font character.

Composers can also install third-party fonts and use them with Finale. When they do so, they must create a FAN file to accompany those fonts. Composers create new FAN files from Finale's Preferences → Edit menu, by selecting the Font Annotation... button.
NOTE: By default, Finale stores FAN files in the ~/​MakeMusic/​Finale ##/​Font Annotation directory.

description: A FAN file is a font annotation file created by MakeMusic Finale, a scorewriter for Windows and macOS. It contains kerning data Finale uses to align font characters. Each Finale font uses its own FAN file.

instructions: You can open a FAN file with MakeMusic Finale (Windows, Mac). To do so:
In the Font Annotation window, click Set Font... to select the font with which you want to use your FAN file.
Navigate to and open your FAN file.
